trans-unit.source: Provides the content for a high fidelity, fixed-format page.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> is typically used to provide the content for a page within a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument>.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> automatically defines page breaks at the start and end of its content.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> used for rendering the page background.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.SubPropertiesDoNotAffectRender%2A>
The brush for rendering the page background.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.Background"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a rectangle defining the overflow area for bleeds, registration marks, and crop marks.

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox%2A> is used to specify an expanded area for print production-related bleeds, registration marks, and crop marks that may extend outside the logical page.
The logical page is the part of the sheet that will remain after it has been cropped to its final size.
So the dimensions of the bleed box can be no smaller than the logical page size, but may be greater.

Contrast the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox%2A> with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A> which is the area of the page on which content can appear; that is, the part of the page that is *within* the margins.
So the dimensions of the content box can be no larger than the page, but may be smaller.

The <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Left%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Right%2A> properties of both the bleed box and the content box are measured from the left and the <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Top%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Bottom%2A> properties are measured from the top.
Hence, the following rules must be enforced in defining the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>:

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Left%2A> must be less than or equal to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Left%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Top%2A> must be less than or equal to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Top%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Right%2A> must be greater than or equal to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Right%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Bottom%2A> must be greater than or equal to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Bottom%2A>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> defining the overflow area.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.Bottom"></xref> attached property.
Gets a collection of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> child elements.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.Children%2A> returns `null` if the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> is data-bound and child elements cannot be added or removed manually.

In non data-bound uses, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.Children%2A> allows the application to manually <xref:System.Windows.Controls.UIElementCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.UIElementCollection.Remove%2A> child elements.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.UIElementCollection"></xref> of the child elements.
Gets or sets the bounding rectangle of the content area; that is, the area of the page *within* the margins, if any.
The following rules must be enforced in defining the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>:

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Left%2A> must be greater than or equal to zero (0), and less than or equal to (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Right%2A>-1).

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Top%2A> must be greater than or equal to zero (0), and less than or equal to (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Bottom%2A>-1).

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Right%2A> must be greater than or equal to (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Left%2A>+1).

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Bottom%2A> must be greater than or equal to (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A>.<xref:System.Windows.Rect.Top%2A>+1).

For rules about the relative sizes of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox%2A>, see the topic <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.BleedBox%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Dependency Property Information
- Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
- None
The <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that defines the content area.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.ContentBox"></xref> dependency property.
Returns the distance between the bottom of an element and the bottom of its parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref>.
If the bottom offset has not been set, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.GetBottom%2A> returns <xref:System.Double.NaN>.
The element from which to get the bottom offset.
The distance between the bottom of an element and the bottom of its parent canvas.
Returns the distance between the left side of an element and the left side of its parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref>.
If the left offset has not been set, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.GetRight%2A> returns <xref:System.Double.NaN>.
The element from which to get the left offset.
The distance between the right side of an element and the right side of its parent canvas.
Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.NavigateUri"></xref> property for a given element.
If the attached property has not been set, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.GetNavigateUri%2A> returns `null`.
The element from which to get the property.
The of element.
Returns the distance between the right side of an element and the right side of its parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref>.
If the right offset has not been set, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.GetRight%2A> returns <xref:System.Double.NaN>.
The element from which to get the right offset.
The distance between the right side of an element and the right side of its parent canvas.
Returns the distance between the top of an element and the top of its parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref>.
If the top offset has not been set, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.GetTop%2A> returns <xref:System.Double.NaN>.
The element from which to get the top offset.
The distance between the top of an element and the top of its parent canvas.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.Left"></xref> attached property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.NavigateUri"></xref> attached property.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that is associated with the page.
A <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> contains information about how material should be printed; for example, whether or not two-sided printing should be used.

Setting this <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.PrintTicket%2A> property does not validate or modify the specified <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> for the page.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.PrintTicket"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.Right"></xref> attached property.
Sets the distance between the bottom of an element and the bottom of its parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref>.
The child element's bottom offset does not affect the size of the parent canvas.
If both a top and a bottom offset have been specified on the same element, the top offset takes precedence.
When setting the bottom offset as a percentage, the percentage value is based on the size of the parent canvas.
The element on which to set the bottom offset.
The new distance between the bottom side of the element and the bottom side of its parent canvas.
Sets the distance between the left side of an element and the left side of its parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref>.
The child element's left offset does not affect the size of the parent canvas.
If both a left and right offset have been specified on the same element, the left offset takes precedence.
When setting the left offset as a percentage, the percentage value is based on the width of the parent canvas.
The element on which to set the left offset.
The new distance between the left side of the element and the left side of its parent canvas.
Sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] to navigate to when a hyperlink is clicked.
The element on which to set the URI offset.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] to navigate to when a hyperlink is clicked.
Sets the distance between the right side of an element and the right side of its parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref>.
The child element's right offset does not affect the size of the parent canvas.
If both a left and a right offset have been specified on the same element, the left offset takes precedence.
When setting the right offset as a percentage, the percentage value is based on the width of the parent canvas.
The element on which to set the right offset.
The new distance between the right side of the element and the right side of its parent canvas.
Sets the distance between the top of an element and the top of its parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref>.
The child element's top offset does not affect the size of the parent canvas.
If both a top and bottom offset have been specified on the same element, the top offset takes precedence.
When setting the top offset as a percentage, the percentage value is based on the size of the parent canvas.
The element on which to set the top offset.
The new distance between the top side of the element and the top side of its parent canvas.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.Top"></xref> attached property.
Adds a child object.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
The text to add to the object.
Gets or sets the base URI of the current application context.
The base URI of the application context.
